DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Oral Cavity Disorder Symptom Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other symptoms of oral cavity lesions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Oral Cavity Disorder Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a symptom (an indication that a person has a condition or disease) of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related oral cavity/mouth (the cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth) disorder.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Oral Cavity Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Related; connected or associated.:No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the oral cavity.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to a symptom.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
